info.title: TMF621 Trouble Ticket API
info.description:
The TMF621 Trouble Ticket API provides a standardized client interface to Trouble Ticket Management Systems for creating, tracking and managing trouble tickets as a result of an issue or problem identified by a customer or another system.
Examples of TMF621 Trouble Ticket API originators (clients) include CRM applications, network management or fault management systems, or other Trouble Ticket management systems (e.g. B2B).
The API supports the ability to send requests to create a new trouble ticket specifying the nature and severity of the trouble or issue as well as all necessary related information.
The API also includes mechanisms to search for and update existing trouble tickets. Notifications are defined to provide information when a trouble ticket has been updated, including status changes.

get.description: This operation list trouble ticket entities. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes. Filtering may be available depending on the compliance level supported by an implementation.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
* Contains the APIX OAuth token as Bearer token.
* Enables the developer application access to the request resource.
* E.g. Authorization:Bearer FhNX09SlBO4G0XRzTPAGustXtsWi

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request HTTP header advertises which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand.

parameters.name: vf-trace-transaction-id
parameters.description:
* Consumer specified unique transaction identifier.
 * Enables requests from consumers to be captured end to end.
* If not provided in the request, one is generated by the backend.
 * Format: Case insensitive, RFC 2616.

parameters.name: vf_ext_bp_id
parameters.description: A unique use case ID used for logging and end-to-end tracing.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated properties to display in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

vf-trace-transaction-id.description:
A unique transaction ID. If provided, the same value is
 returned, Otherwise a new transaction id is generated.

Pragma.description: to be picked from the backend if available otherwise set as "no-cache"

value.name: A test ticket
value.ticketArea: This is an extension required by Greece. It represents the area to which the ticket belongs to.
value.ticketSubArea: This is an extension required by Greece. It represents the sub area to which the ticket belongs to

note.text: This is a note related to the ticket itself
note.author: Customer

patch.description: This operation allows partial updates of a trouble ticket entity. Support of json/merge (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7386) is mandatory, support of json/patch (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5789) is optional. Note - If the update operation yields to the creation of sub-resources or relationships, the same rules concerning mandatory sub-resource attributes and default value settings in the POST operation applies to the PATCH operation. Hence these tables are not repeated here.

scopes.TROUBLE_TICKET_ALL: API Consumer is allowed to consume all the operations.
scopes.TMF621_TROUBLE_TICKET_API_ALL: API Consumer is allowed to consume all the operations.

TroubleTicket.description: A trouble ticket is a record of an issue that is created, tracked, and managed by a trouble ticket management system

id.description: Unique identifier of the trouble ticket

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the trouble ticket entity

name.description: Name of the trouble ticket, typically a short description provided by the user that create the ticket

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

ticketType.description: represent a business type of the trouble ticket e.g. incident, complain, request

ticketArea.description: This is an extension to TMF required by Greece to map the object to the the related CSM representation.

ticketSubArea.description: This is an extension to TMF required by Greece to map the object to the the related CSM representation.

creationDate.description: The date on which the trouble ticket was created

lastUpdate.description: The date and time that the trouble ticked was last updated

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

status.description: The current status of the trouble ticket

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

@type.description: The (class) type of the trouble ticket. e.g. billingTicket, networkTicket, resourceTicket

@baseType.description: The base type (class) of the resource. Here can be 'TroubleTicket'

@schemaLocation.description: Link to the schema describing this REST resource

relatedEntity.description: An entity that is related to the ticket such as a bill, a product, etc. The entity against which the ticket is associated.

statusChange.description: The status change history that are associated to the ticket.Populated by the server

note.description: The note(s) that are associated to the ticket.

relatedParty.description: The related party(ies) that are associated to the ticket.

ticketRelationship.description: A list of trouble ticket relationships (TroubleTicketRelationship [*]). Represents a relationship between trouble tickets

attachment.description: File(s) attached to the trouble ticket. e.g. pictur of broken device, scaning of a bill or charge

description.description: Description of the trouble or issue

externalId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

ticketType.description: represent a business type of the trouble ticket e.g. incident, complain, request

ticketArea.description: This is an extension to TMF required by Greece to map the object to the the related CSM representation.

ticketSubArea.description: This is an extension to TMF required by Greece to map the object to the the related CSM representation.

severity.description:
The severity of the issue. Indicate the implication of the issue on the expected functionality e.g. of a system, application, service etc.. 
Severity values can be for example : Critical, Major, Minor

priority.description: The priority of the trouble ticket and how quickly the issue should be resolved. Example: Critical, High, Medium, Low. The value is set by the ticket management system considering the severity, ticket type etc...

requestedResolutionDate.description: The resolution date requested by the user

expectedResolutionDate.description: The expected resolution date determined by the trouble ticket system

resolutionDate.description: The date and time the trouble ticket was resolved

status.description: The current status of the trouble ticket

statusChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the status

relatedEntity.description: An entity that is related to the ticket such as a bill, a product, etc. The entity against which the ticket is associated.

note.description: The note(s) that are associated to the ticket.

relatedParty.description: The related party(ies) that are associated to the ticket.

ticketRelationship.description: A list of trouble ticket relationships (TroubleTicketRelationship [*]). Represents a relationship between trouble tickets

attachment.description: File(s) attached to the trouble ticket. e.g. pictur of broken device, scaning of a bill or charge

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

RelatedEntityRef.description: Related Entity reference. Reference to an arbitrary entity from a context entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of the related entity

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the related entity (e.g. customerBill, productOrder, etc.)

name.description: The name of the related entity if applicable (e.g. name of the customer, name of the bill, name of the product etc...)

role.description: The role of the related entity in the context of the contained resource (e.g. disputedBill, damagedDevice

@referredType.description: A string. Indicates the type (class) of related entity. For example, Product Order Customer Bill, Payment, etc.

Channel.description: The communication channel for example WEB, Call Center

StatusChange.description: Holds the status notification reasons and associated date the status changed, populated by the server

status.description: The status of the trouble ticket

changeReason.description: The reason why the status changed.

changeDate.description: The date and time the status changed.

Note.description: Extra information about a given entity

date.description: The date that the note created

author.description: The name of the note author, can be the agent name or any other party that created the note

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

@referredType.description: A string. Indicates the type (class) of related party. For example, Organization or Individual (if party), Customer, Supplier, etc. (if party role).

TicketRelationship.description: Represents a relationship between trouble tickets

id.description: Unique identifier of the related trouble ticket

href.description: Hyperlink, a reference to the related trouble ticket entity

type.description: Type of the trouble ticket relationship can be isChiled, dependent etc...

Attachment.description: Attachment refers to extensions or additional parts that is or may be attached to something (agreements, contracts, appointments) to perform a particular function. They can be communication attachments, documents and other.

size.description: The size in Bytes of the of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data; if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document.

description.description: the description of the binary attachment

sizeUnit.description: The unit of measure for the size

mimeType.description: mimeType of the Attachement ( e,g application/pdf)

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of the attachment.

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error.

message.description: (optional) Text that provide more details and corrective actions related to the error.

referenceError.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.

@type.description: (optional) The class type of a REST resource.

@schemaLocation.description: (optional) A link to the schema describing a REST resource.
